thread.title: Amtrak train derails in Vermont; at least 4 injured - Vermont news
thread.title_full: Amtrak train derails in Vermont; at least 4 injured - Vermont news

author: boston.com
title: Amtrak train derails in Vermont; at least 4 injured - Vermont news
text:
An Amtrak train derailed in Vermont Monday morning, injuring at least four people, the railroad said.
A statement from Amtrak said Train 55 was traveling from Saint Albans, VT to Washington, D.C., when it derailed after reportedly striking a rock slide on the tracks.
Three of the train’s five cars went over a steep embankment around 10:30 a.m. in the town of Northfield, about 70 miles south of Saint Albans, said Lt. Leon Eggleston of the Montpelier Fire Department.
 Four people were transported to the Central Vermont Medical Center, Eggleston said. No information was available on their conditions.
Wow.. Parents were just in a train accident in the NE.. They are safe but others injured. pic.twitter.com/xYEMXNJhjY
